title: Kieler Woche Open Ship Day
content: The lab setup an educational booth at the Kieler Woche Open Ship Day, demonstrating how acoustic telemetry functions, and explaining the various ways we can study how fish behave in the sea. The ship was packed with visitors.

images.caption: The lab at the Kieler Woche Open Ship Day 2025 after the event (Natalie Klinard, Felix Mittermayer-Schmittmann, Christopher Monk, Pina Hentschel and Fenja-Marie Möller)

title: Fenja-Marie Möller ICFT Presentation
content: Fenja presented her M.Sc. thesis results at the International Conference on Fish Telemetry in Traverse City, Michigan. Her talk was titled 'Monitoring the Danish Straits using acoustic telemetry to understand how environmental drivers influence fish migrations in a major swimway'

images.caption: Fenja delivering her talk at ICFT 2025

title: Littorina Cruise
content: The lab was out on the FK Littorina to Boknis Eck for some equipment testing and receiver deployment trials.

title: sMacrobehaviour meeting
content: Christopher Monk joined the sMacrobehaviour meeting in Leipzig, an sDIV working group focused on understanding the macroecology of vertebrate behaviour. Read more about the project here: sMacrobehaviour.

title: Lab Christmas Party
content: The Marine Behavioural Ecology Lab had their annual Christmas party today, enjoying the Kiel Christmas markets

images.caption: Winter weather at the Kiel Christmas markets

title: Mohammadreza defends thesis
content: Mohammadreza Hemmati successfully defended his Master's thesis, 'A Quantitative assessment of an exploration-exploitation framework to predict at-sea fisher social behaviour: insights from the Mediterranean bluefin tuna fishery', today. Congratulations Mohammadreza!!

title: Marina defends thesis
content: Marina Ehmke successfully defended her Bachelor's thesis, 'Does animal personality correlate with feeding behaviour in a Baltic amphipod', today. Congratulations Marina!!

title: sARDINE second meeting
content: The sARDINE sDiv working group is having their second meeting at iDiv in Leipzig, Germany this week. Read more about the work here .

images.caption: sARDINE 2 group photo at iDiv, Leipzig, Germany

title: Presenting at the European Tracking Network Symposium
content: Christopher Monk is presenting at the European Tracking Network Symposium in Mallorca, Spain. The talk will cover sARDINE related work on 'An interactive web-based application for creating synthetic multimodal fish movementto evaluatea and train machine-learning models' .

title: Attending FishBase Symposium
content: Christopher Monk is attending the annual FishBase Symposium and FishBase Consortium meeting, held this year in Thessaloniki, Greece, at the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki.

title: Sam defends thesis
content: Samantha Juber successfully defended her Master's thesis, 'Comparing the performance of distributed acoustic sensing to traditional passive acoustic monitoring for baleen whale conservation', today. Way to go Sam!!

title: Nils Kreuter visits as guest
content: Nils Kreuter is visiting the Marine Behavioural Ecology group as a guest PhD student from the Australian National University. Nils has successfully acquired a Helmholtz Information and Data Science Academy (HIDA) exchange to support his visit. He will focus on building visualization and interactive data analysis tools for Australian acoustic telemetry datasets at the centre of his PhD work, and will be with us for 3 months.

title: Attending Digital Ocean Forum
content: Christopher Monk is in Brussels, Belgium on for the DTOTrack project. The prototype of the European Digital Twin of the Ocean will be presented at the event. The digital twin of animal movement in the North Sea will be embedded on this new platform.

title: sARDINE first meeting
content: The sARDINE sDiv working group is having their first meeting at iDiv in Leipzig, Germany this week. Read more about the work here .

images.caption: sARDINE 1 group photo at iDiv, Leipzig, Germany

title: New project: DTOTrack
content: The Marine Behavioural Ecology Group will be starting a new project: DTOTrack, to construct a prototype digital twin of the animal movement in the north sea. The project is funded by the Sustainable Blue Economy Partnership, includes 11 partners and will run until May 2027.

title: Joining the IFishMan Retreat
content: Christopher Monk is attending the 2nd International IFishMan workshop on Interdisciplinary Recreational Fisheries Science and Management, organized in Siggen, Germany

title: Attending FishBase Symposium
content: Christopher Monk attended the annual FishBase Symposium and FishBase Consortium meeting, held this year in Tervuren, Belgium at the Royal Museum for Central Africa.

title: sARDINE project funded
content: The sDiv working group sARDINE hosted at iDiv, Leipzig, Germany has received funding to tackle the spatial trends in fish ethodiversity. The group, led by Christopher Monk, will devise new methods to quantify fish behavioural diversity from acoustic telemetry tracks and evaluate gradients in fish behavioural diversity from a collection of European telemetry datasets.

title: Attending ICFT 8
content: The Marine Biology Group attended the International Conference on Fish Telemetry 8 in Sete France from the 11-16 of June. We presented two posters, introducing a new software for visualizing telemetry in 3d, and covering our analysis of cod diets and personality.

title: Alkor cruise Al594
content: Christopher Monk joined the second leg of the AL594 cruise, onboard the research vessel Alkor, in the Baltic Sea. As a research group new to the Baltic Sea, this was a great opportunity to get some hands on experience in the ecosystem and evaluate several capture methods and study sites.

title: Theses projects available
content: Interested in doing a B.Sc. or M.Sc. thesis in the Marine Behavioural Ecology group? Data-driven projects on high-resolution fish behaviour, and lab-based behavioural experiments are currently available to start. In 2024 field based projects will also begin. Please get in touch for more details.

title: Marie Ritter starts an internship
content: Marie Ritter has started a 6 week internship. The internship will cover data analysis of animal movement, acoustic telemetry fundamentals, and range testing in the field. Welcome Marie!
